intro: Microlicia sciophylla, commonly known as the shadow fern, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds that thrive in shaded, humid environments. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually small and closely arranged, contributing to its overall compact appearance. Microlicia sciophylla plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat by providing shelter and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
